intro: Achrouteria pomifera, commonly known as the gooseberry tree, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It produces small, edible berries that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant has alternate, simple leaves that are often oval or elliptical in shape. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. The berries are an important food source for various wildlife species.
